connector.description: Run compute operations on an Ignite cluster.

camel.sink.endpoint.clusterGroupExpressi.name: camel.sink.endpoint.clusterGroupExpression
camel.sink.endpoint.clusterGroupExpressi.description: An expression that returns the Cluster Group for the IgniteCompute instance.

camel.sink.endpoint.computeName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.computeName
camel.sink.endpoint.computeName.description: The name of the compute job, which will be set via IgniteCompute#withName(String).

camel.sink.endpoint.executionType.name: camel.sink.endpoint.executionType
camel.sink.endpoint.executionType.description: The compute operation to perform. Possible values: CALL, BROADCAST, APPLY, EXECUTE, RUN, AFFINITY_CALL, AFFINITY_RUN. The component expects different payload types depending on the operation. One of: [CALL] [BROADCAST] [APPLY] [EXECUTE] [RUN] [AFFINITY_CALL] [AFFINITY_RUN]

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.propagateIncomingBod.name: camel.sink.endpoint.propagateIncomingBodyIfNoReturnValue
camel.sink.endpoint.propagateIncomingBod.description: Sets whether to propagate the incoming body if the return type of the underlying Ignite operation is void.

camel.sink.endpoint.taskName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.taskName
camel.sink.endpoint.taskName.description: The task name, only applicable if using the IgniteComputeExecutionType#EXECUTE execution type.

camel.sink.endpoint.timeoutMillis.name: camel.sink.endpoint.timeoutMillis
camel.sink.endpoint.timeoutMillis.description: The timeout interval for triggered jobs, in milliseconds, which will be set via IgniteCompute#withTimeout(long).

camel.sink.endpoint.treatCollectionsAsCa.name: camel.sink.endpoint.treatCollectionsAsCacheObjects
camel.sink.endpoint.treatCollectionsAsCa.description: Sets whether to treat Collections as cache objects or as Collections of items to insert/update/compute, etc.

camel.component.ignite-compute.configura.name: camel.component.ignite-compute.configurationResource
camel.component.ignite-compute.configura.description: The resource from where to load the configuration. It can be a: URL, String or InputStream type.

camel.component.ignite-compute.ignite.name: camel.component.ignite-compute.ignite
camel.component.ignite-compute.ignite.description: To use an existing Ignite instance.

camel.component.ignite-compute.igniteCon.name: camel.component.ignite-compute.igniteConfiguration
camel.component.ignite-compute.igniteCon.description: Allows the user to set a programmatic ignite configuration.

camel.component.ignite-compute.lazyStart.name: camel.component.ignite-compute.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.ignite-compute.lazyStart.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.ignite-compute.autowired.name: camel.component.ignite-compute.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.ignite-compute.autowired.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
